chapter.title: Editing lines
chapter.para: editorline You can use the line editor for features such as fronts and jet axes to add additional details to your depictions. Line edit tools

listitem.para:
Select the Draw tool.
Draw
The Draw menus appear. (see ) Line draw menus
The cursor appears as a pencil while inside the map area.
Select a Line Type from the list.
Draw the line. (see or )
The selected line type appears.

Select the Modify tool.
Modify
Pick the line to delete. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Delete.

Select the Move tool.
Move
Pick the line(s) to delete. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cut.
To restore the line(s), click the &right; mouse button and select Undo or Paste.

sect1.title: Moving a line
sect1.para:
line field editormove To move one or more lines.
Select the Move tool.
Move
Pick the line(s) to move. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Translate.
The picked lines turn blue.
Pick a reference point on the map and hold the &left; mouse button down.
The reference point can be anywhere; however, if you are moving a portion of the line(s) off the depiction it is important to pick a point that will remain on the depiction after the move. The lines shimmer indicating you can now move them.
Drag the line(s) to the new location and release the button.
The &FPA; then recomputes the field and re-displays the new line(s) in white.
Note: The lines remain selected until you deselect them, so you may continue to use the Move tools. (see )

sect1.title: Rotating a line
sect1.para:
line field editorrotate To rotate a line:
Select the Move tool.
Move
Pick the line(s) to rotate. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Rotate.
The picked lines turn blue.
Click the &left; mouse button at the point you want to rotate around (the centre of rotation).
Select a second point to form a handle to rotate the line(s) and hold the button down.
A line displays between the two chosen points. This is your rotation handle (like the handle of a car window).
Turn the handle to a new location.
When you have reached the point where the rotation should end, release the &left; mouse button.
The &FPA; displays the rotated line(s).
Note: You can still restore the field if you click Undo at this point.
Note: The lines remain selected until you deselect them, so you may continue to use the Move tools. (see )

sect1.title: Copying a line
sect1.para: line field editorcopy You can copy a line by using Copy and Paste with the Move tool.

listitem.para:
Select the Move tool.
Move
The move menus appear. (see )
Select Include Labels if you want to include labels.
Pick the line(s) to copy. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Copy.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to deselect all lines, or move to another depiction.
Paste is now available.
Note: if pasted to the same depiction the lines will be automatically offset to avoid inadvertent duplication.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Paste.
The lines remain selected until you deselect them, thus Translate and Rotate are available in the &right; mouse button context menu. (see and )
Note: You can still remove the copied field if you click Undo at this point.

sect1.title: Flipping a line
sect1.para: line field editorflip Some line styles are not symmetrical. You can use this tool to flip the line across its width or along its length.

listitem.para:
Select the Flip tool.
Flip
Pick the line to flip. (see )

Click the &right; mouse button and select: &colwidth2;
Select...To...
Flip to flip it across its width.
Reverse to flip the line along its length.
Flip & Reverse to flip it across its width and along its length.

sect1.title: Modifying a line
sect1.para: line field editormodify Modify allows you to change the shape of a line, to extend or shorten a line, or to change a line type.

You can modify lines with two types of drawing tools. &colwidth2;
Select...To...
a drawing tool draw a new line segment
one of the puck sizes sculpt an existing line or extend/shorten a line

listitem.para:
Select the Modify tool.
Modify
The Modify menus appear. (see ) Line modify menus
Pick the line to modify. (see )
The picked line turns yellow, with blue boxes at both ends.

Select the "Freehand"
or "Curve" drawing tool.
Draw the new line segment. Start or end the line as close to the existing line as possible.

The way the line gets redrawn depends on how the new segment was drawn.
If the new segment starts and ends on the existing line, the new line segment adopts the direction of the existing line. (see ) New segment starts and ends on the existing line
If the new segment starts, but does not end, on the existing line, the new line segment connects to the existing line in the direction it was drawn. Thus the end of the existing line is replaced by the new segment. (see ) New segment starts, but does not end, on the existing line
If the new segment ends, but does not start, on the existing line, the new line segment connects to the existing line in the direction it was drawn. Thus the start of the existing line is replaced by the new segment. (see ) New segment ends, but does not start, on the existing line
If the new segment starts and ends too far away from the existing line, the new line segment will replace the existing line. (see ) New segment starts and ends too far away from existing line
The new line turns blue and the original line remains yellow.
If the line is acceptable, click the &right; mouse button and select Confirm. If the line is not acceptable select Cancel and the line will remain selected you can attempt the edit again.

Select the Modify tool.
Modify
The Modify menus appear. (see )
Pick the line to modify. (see )
The picked line turns yellow, with blue boxes at both ends.
Select a puck size. (see )
The number indicates the proportional size of the puck.
The cursor appears as concentric circles while inside the map window.
Choose a smoothing mode. (see )
Click and hold the &left; mouse button to activate the sculpting puck.
The line is modified when the puck comes in contact with it.
Release the button when finished.
You can repeat the previous step as often as you wish.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to complete the edit.

orderedlist.title: To extend or shorten a line by sculpting:

listitem.para:
Select the Modify tool.
Modify
Pick the line to modify. (see )
The picked line turns yellow, with blue boxes at both ends.
Select a puck size. (see )
The number indicates the proportional size of the puck.
Choose a smoothing mode. (see )
Click and hold the &left; mouse button inside one of the blue boxes.
The cursor changes to a pencil while the button is held down.
Drag the cursor to a new location.
If you drag the cursor along the line towards the opposite end, the line will be shortened. If you drag the cursor away from the line, the line will be extended.
Release the button when finished.
You can repeat the previous step as often as you wish.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to complete the edit.

orderedlist.title: To extend a line by redrawing:

listitem.para:
Select the Modify tool.
Modify
Pick the line to modify. (see )
The picked line turns yellow, with blue boxes at both ends.
Select a drawing tool. (see )
Start or end the extension inside one of the a blue boxes.
With the "Freehand" tool click and hold the &left; mouse button. The cursor changes to a pencil while the button is held down.
With the "Curve" tool click the &left; mouse button. The cursor changes to a pencil while in "Curve" draw mode.
Draw the extension.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to complete the edit.

Select the Join tool.
Join

Pick two lines to join.
The lines must be of the same type. (see )
The picked lines turn yellow.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Join.
The new line remains selected until you deselect it, thus you may continue to join another line to the new one.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to deselect all lines, or move to another depiction.

orderedlist.title: To break one line into two lines:

listitem.para:
Select the Join tool.
Join
Pick a line to break. (see )
The picked line turns yellow.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Break.
Pick a break point on the line.

orderedlist.title: To change the type of line:

listitem.para:
Select the Modify tool.
Modify
The Modify menus appear. (see )
Pick the line to modify. (see )
From the line list, pick a line type.
The line is redrawn as the selected type.

sect1.title: Merging information in a line field
sect1.para: line field editormerge You can bring a field from another source and time and merge it into the depiction using the Merge tool.

listitem.para:
Select the Merge tool.
Merge
The Merge menus appear. (see )
Select the Source, Issue Time and Valid Time of the other field you wish to merge with your current depiction.
Note: Your System Administrator may configure a field to accept merges from another "compatible" field. If this is the case, there will be a Field list in the Merge Fields area.
Select Include Labels if you want to include labels.
Click Fetch.
The field information from the other source is laid over top of your depiction.
Pick the line(s) to merge. (see )

Finish your selection by pressing the &right; mouse button and select &colwidth2;
Select...To...
Merge merge information in place
Translate move and merge the information
Rotate rotate and merge the information
Note: the picked information remains selected, so you may perform multiple translate and rotate operations.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to complete the merge.

orderedlist.title: To label points on some lines:

listitem.para:
Select the Labelling tool.
Label
Click the &right; mouse button and select a Label Type.

Click the &right; mouse button and select a Label Action: &colwidth2;
Select...To...
Label ActionAdd add a label at a specified point
Label ActionMove facilitate clicking and dragging a label from one location to another (if applicable)
Label ActionShow display a list of attributes of the particular label selected
Label ActionModify change label attributes
Label ActionDelete delete a label
Note: some labels have fixed attributes and cannot be modified. In these cases the Modify tool does not appear.
Pick a point to label using the &left; mouse button.
If you have picked Add...
Labels appear on the closest line object.
Note: If your label type requires additional information, an entry menu may appear. You can modify the information as required. Clicking on Set Attributes will add the label.
If you have picked Move, Show, Modify or Delete ...
The nearest label is chosen.
To delete all the labels, click the &right; mouse button and select Clear.

sect1.title: Sampling values from a line field
sect1.para: line field editorsample You can add temporary labels to the &FPA; window with the Sample tool.

listitem.para:
Select the Sample tool.
Sample
The Sample menus appear. (see )
The cursor appears as cross-hairs while inside the map window.
Select the type of sample you want from the Sample Item area.
You can choose to sample All Attributes or a single attribute from the list.
Select the display attributes: colour, size and font.
Pick a point on the depiction.
A temporary label appears.
You can sample as many points as you want.
Note: If you selected All Attributes, a dialog box appears displaying All Attributes for the point.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Clear to clear the samples from the depiction.

sect1.para: Note: if you select All Attributes from the Sample Item area, the Preset Points option cannot be used. Only single attributes can be displayed with this option.
